Ratings.comment: Dr. Sawyer is genuinely one of the kindest profs I've met not only in the Geology program, but across the university as a whole. He's not afraid to joke in his lectures, and he makes them genuinely engaging. His tests are creative and thought-provoking without being unnecessarily difficult. If he's teaching your GE class you should be excited!

Not really a science a person but I learned a lot in his class. He had a great sense of humor and was very knowledgable. There were 5 exercises, 5 quizzes (lowest dropped), and 3 homework assignments. Attendance wasn't mandatory but it helped, and he posted his lectures after each class. Need a science gen ed, I encourage this class!

Really really awesome guy. Definitely cares about his students, easy exams, posts ALL of the lectures online but I still went to class anyway because he was cool and made the material interesting. I recommend EarthSci 2210 with him for sure
it was a privilege and a pleasure to be his student. He is a geologist who will be in the history books.
A terrific professor!
Good guy, tough tests but goes out of his way to help you.
i feel like he had such good intentions but just, ugh. the lectures are super boring, and the midterms are on material that is not found in the book, powerpoints, or lecture. so awful.
The exams are pretty tough, so make sure you get a good lab grade. I really enjoyed the class, Professor Webb has a lot of experience in his field and he has amazing stories to tell.
He is a really nice guy.  His tests are hard though.  There are only two midterms, a final, and lab grade.

Professor Webb was a great teacher who really does care about his students. I had him for Earth Science 100 and then Oceanography. I enjoyed both classes because Webb has so much knowledge about our environment and it 's very fun to pick his brain. He has so many good stories about his travels all over the world.

Great accent; he's from New Zealand if I remember correctly.  Somewhat difficult to follow at first, but he's a very interesting lecturer.  Speaks with subtle humor that he may not even notice.  Attendance is not mandatory, but it's worth it to go.  Never spoke to him one-on-one, but he seemly quite friendly and approachable.  Exams were fair.

Webb is preplexing. He is a nice guy, has great intentions, but is a very poor communictor.  I like to listen to him talk, but I would not take any more classes from him. BTW - he has a peak in Antarctica named after him!

Tests are hard and cover material you will probably never learn. Studying the lectures, labs, and notes will not help you much at all. He gives extra credit at the end of some classes but almost no one can ever make it through an entire lecture. He seems like a nice person, just not a great teacher. Just guess on tests and hope for the best.

Webb is a nice guy, but his exams test things he never taught. He likes to keep students interested so he lectures on interesting things but then tests on detailed topics not explained in class. Difficult to know what to study for. Labs are easy. I know there are better professors to take Earth Science with.

Extremely boring teacher.  The way he presented his notes were very confusing. Asked very unfair questions on the exams which ended up being very hard.  Best thing that happened was he left towards the end of the quarter for Antartica (very unprofessional) and Christine O'Malley taught the rest of the class. She was pretty helpful.

Such a great guy! Has great stories and a New Zealand accent.  Lectures are somewhat boring but he tries to make them interesting.  Study his practice tests online for tests.  They seem hard but there's usually a huge curve.  TAKE HIM!!

make sure you get 100% on the labs!  The tests are hard unless you study his old exams which he gives out online.  Reading the book helps but studying his in class notes will give you a better idea of what to focus on.

He's a funny guy and very energetic but the lectures consist of LOTS of boring movies and he tends to put up diagrams and talk on them forever. The exams are fairly easy as long as you study the questions he gives you in class. For a GEC, it's a decent class to take.
he is fun teacher in the classroom and very enthusiastic.  his tests are hard and at many times irrelivant but gives a VERY nice curve... great teacher

The exams were really hard, a lot of obscure questions that you really had to study the book a lot to know.  But I believe there will be a huge curve so It won't be that bad.  Webb is an awesome guy and teacher.  He is very accomidating and willing to go the extra mile to help a person out.  He moved my final so I wouldn't have 3 in one day.

Probably THE best prof I've ever had.  The lectures can be boring- but hey your learning about rocks and the earth.  Get to know him well and he'll go out of his way to make sure you understand.  Great class and awesome prof.  I would definately take it!

I wasn't interested in the class at all, but Dr. Webb was very helpful in encouraging me to do well after bombing both the midterms.  He's the best professor I've ever had and I'm glad I took the class just to get to know him. Study online, read and don't fall asleep in class and you'll do fine. ;)

TO PASS THIS CLASS YOU MUST STUDY FROM HIS ONLINE PRACTICE TESTS!!! This is something that I didn't know until the very end and it could have made my grade MUCH higher! Once I finally did realize he had practice tests I saw his exams are word for word.
He really didn't care about teaching and put the most detailed questions on the exams.  Go to class if you want to be able to understand the notes at all.  I think he wanted people to do badly.

Professor Webb was excellent. He showed a video nearly every week to go with the notes. All his notes are online. The tests and final are all MC and fairly easy and half the final is exactly from the first two midterms. He curves the course as well. Definitely looks like Michael Caine

Looks just like Michael Caine (Austin Powers's dad)...but seriously he knows his stuff and presents a lot of material in lecture. He is pretty funny at times as well. However, his exams are tricky if you aren't a geologist. He is available outside of class for help though. Tough GEC, but not too bad
This prof. really knows his stuff.  Lots of lectures and lots of films on the various things we cover.
Wow.  I am a senior and I am so glad that I had a chance to learn from him before I graduate.  He is a rare species. He is what I went to college for.  To learn from someone who has seen and done.

Organized classroom presentation, I was a visiting student that sat in on a lecture to help me decide if OSU was for me. His lecture on plate techtonics was great, I think that I would like to attend more of Dr. Webb's courses. Good movie on NZ birds.
Helpful, realistic, caring, knowledgable beyond belief.  Highly reccommended.
Easy class.  Really knows his stuff.  Most helpful professor I've had.  This is a good GEC to fulfill your lab requirement.

A very interesting class, however it is pretty tough.  Professor Webb is very helpful and whenever I e-mailed him with questions he usually got back to me that same day.  he has a charming personality and is really intelligent.  The labs were fun.
very knowledgeable, tests can be strange, but he's a fair grader, and he is extremely helpful and always willing to meet with or email students who have questions

never went to class cuz it was SO boring. notes are confusing &  there are too many diagrams. labs are pointless & a waste of my time. he did know what he was talking about though, when i actually went to class.
I loved him. He's a GREAT teacher. I think he's the best teacher I've had at OSU. he made the class fun and really worthwhile.

Oceanography.  Great professor.  Has all kinds of real world experience, i.e. Discovery Channel documentaries, etc.  Very smart, knows his stuff, been around for a long time. He's a Kiwi. HIGHLY recommend.

Prof. Gnidovec is a nice guy and gives great on topic and interesting lectures. This guy is old school though, YOU NEED TO GO TO LECTURE. The labs were super easy and the exams were just as easy if you knew your shit. I'm a Geology major so it came easy for me but some people may have a harder time.

He is definitely knowledgeable and passionate about his lectures. If you go to the lectures you will definitely pass the tests. The downside is that he uses pack back, but its not that hard to come up with stuff for it- just annoying. The study guides are your lifeline in this class. Lab is 20%, 4 exams are 70%, and pack back is 10%.
Best of luck!
He is such a sweet man! So knowledgeable and has so much experience in this field, yet he is humble and approachable. I would definitely take him!!

Dale is almost as passionate about the subject as he is about torturing GenEd students. Unless you want a C+ avoid at all costs. I type this as I sit in his lecture and he is currently rambling about bacon or something. His lectures are disorganized and hard to follow, and he provides no online notes or review sheets. Garbage class.

Poor lecturing overall. He seems enthusiastic, but in fact he is just being loud and noisy. He does not give any notes, quizzes, practices, review sheets. All the tests is based on his lecturing. So you need to go to class every lecture. And he did a bad job on clarifying the definition. Exams are super hard. TA is nice. Worst experience in OSU.

I was a fan of this guy at first. He is enthusiastic and makes a somewhat boring subject more interesting. Then we had our first mid term yesterday. What just happened? He claims for weeks that the exams will be over ONLY the vocab lists he puts on the board each day, but then 1/4 of the test is random crap unrelated to said lists. Not cool.

He's enthusiastic and really loves earth science. His powerpoints are all pictures, his handwriting on the chalk board is scattered and can barely be read, and he puts nothing on Carmen. Exams are very difficult all short answer or fill in the blank. I'm a good student and thought this was a challenge. Do not take if you want a semi easy GE

One of the most passionate professors I've ever had at Ohio State. Powerpoint slides do not help prepare for exams so take good notes. Exams are fill in the blank, short answer, and extended response so they are more difficult than you would expect. As long as you go to class and take good notes, you'll get a good grade on exams.

4 test all semester  not cumulative  only off of power points  avg on test 80% - GO TO CLASS  only way to get the things that will be tested. - Labs  easy - Im EARTHSC major, and class was super interesting to me - he passes around fossils almost every Class - I help a dinosaur fossil in my hand one day!  - He's an old guy who loves geology

One of the most enthusiastic professors I've ever had. You can definitely tell that he is passionate about what he teaches. Lectures were always well prepared, and he never seemed to have an issue keeping my attention. A very charismatic lecturer.  Go to class; go over the lectures a few times; memorize the terms and you'll do well on his exams.

Slideshows are all pictures of dinosaurs and drawings. Exams are harder than you expect; not multiple choice and no word bank. The middle of the quarter he steps on everyone's beliefs with the evolution lecture.  Makes fun of Christian's beliefs relentlessly. Don't take if you're a strong Christian you'll be distracted the whole time.

Really had to pay attention in lectures, his power points were of all pictures so you had to listen to what he says and write notes from it, makes the class very difficult because he talked so fast. The exams were incredibly difficult. All short answer problems, usually 40-50 per exam

Ok honestly super interesting man. He is definetly interested in the material, but his testing is ridiculous. He claims to not be a mind reader, well neither are students.His test consist of 50 vocab words to use for short answer essay and fill in the blank...no vocab box. Whatever I passed could of taken online though.
One of the best professors that I have ever had. He is very enthusiastic and is always willing to help. If you memorize the terms you will do well.

He is so cute! he is OBSESSED with dinosaurs fossils and this class. He is super cool and knowledgable. one midterm average was a low B so he gave an optional 20 pt extra credit paper! If you don't do well in this class then you must have NEVER gone to class and were lazy. memorize stuff and you will get over 100%
nice class labs takes time but pretty easy if you try

Easy class if you attend and take good notes. He saves his students money by not making the book necessary, you only need it if you are bad at science. His exam reviews are exactly what is on the exam. Easy class to pass. The labs are super easy.
Harder than expected. Recommend going to class because he tells you what is on test and gives pop quizzes. Labs are easy A. Tests are difficult. Not an easy A

So friendly, willing to work with u, makes material clear. Gives a curve in the class (77% was a B). Attendance isnt mandatory but id defiantly recommend it because he give u the questions to exams sometimes during lectures. Labs super easy. Exams multiple choice, has 4 pop quizzes only worth 5% of ur grade and he reuses the quiz questions on exams

Barker's tests are harder than you would expect for a 100 level GEC. He does curve, however, in a fair way. The class average (was around a 77 for us) turns into a B. He's passionate about earth science. Overall, he was a good prof but not an easy A... Took some work to get one.
Boring subject, but he's a great teacher. Has a lot of passion for the subject and makes it easy to understand. Be ready that the tests are harder than you'd expect for a 100 level class.

I had him for EarthSci 100. He is Canadian which is kind of fun. Attendance are not mandatory but he had 3 random quizes during the quarter (5% of grade) he posts powerpoint lectures online, but exams are strangely hard (avg = 39/60) but he does curve at the end.

Understands that most people are taking this for a GEC--is super understanding and tries to make it as easy as possible. Grades in a way that is favorable to students, e.g.: Best exam=25%, middle exam=20%, worst exam=15%. Recommended for those taking a GEC class.
He is very easy and straight forward. He knows its a GEC and doesn't make you work too hard for it. He's super cute as well!
Very easy. Exams are straight forward. If you go to lectures, he'll tell you what would be on exams. And he's not bad looking for a teacher :)
Very adept at using characters from the Simpsons to explain geology concepts. Make sure you go to lectures, he gives very good examples and outlines what you need to study for exams. Canadian.

Babcock is a nice guy, but the structure of this class is awful. 75% of your grade is based on seven 25 question multiple choice midterms. Therefore each question you miss is around 0.5% off your final grade. The questions are somewhat vague with multiple "correct" answers but only one truly correct one. Textbook helped on tests, lectures did not.

He is clearly very knowledgeable in his field. I liked the class a lot, the material was very interesting. My problem was the grading was split 75% quiz grades 25% lab grades. It skews it so labs mean nothing and if you don't do so hot on a quiz or two it's almost impossible to pull it back up to an A. The quizzes also got very hard near the end.
He's a really interesting and engaging lecturer. Class isn't too difficult, but you need to go to lecture and labs will take some time. Totally worth it.

Babcock really knows what he's talking about and is excited to share it. Midterms were easy, final is hard. Very nice curve + extra credit at the end. Very accessible outside of class and no homework outside of lab. Lenient grader. That said, lectures tended to drag and the pace of the class is very slow. Some background in geology is helpful.

Take this class if you'd like to understand the material, not to get an A. Dr. Babcock is a great lecturer. However, there aren't many grades entered and the exams are all writing so you must truly know all the content presented in the class. Expect to memorize/study a lot, he even had stuff on the final that was not mentioned in his power points.
Too much to review for exam

A lot of reviews on here complain abt Babcock's tests, but they're not hard at all. He posts all lecture slides to Carmen so attendance isn't mandatory, and he literally wrote the textbook for this class so u can easily access it for xtra help. As long as you take a bare minimum few days to study the definitions you'll pass. he also gives hints

babcock is an odd guy, but in a good way. Tests are tough, but definitely possible to get an A on if you actually read over the lecture material the night before and ask him what to expect. They are all short answer questions, no multiple choice or fill in the blank, but he leaves room for error. If you are looking for an easy class maybe not his.
No homework, no quiz, no attendance check. Then guess what? You FAIL YOUR EXAMS while EXAMS are 75% of your total grades. If you don't want to experience a dark semester, DROP IT NOW!

Alright, so first off, don't buy the book for this class because it is a complete waste. Second, Babcock is a pretty nice guy and he is willing to work with you. Many people think this class is hard, when in reality its not really that hard. The class is one midterm that is strictly memorizing 4 powerpoint.... thats it. Final is also memorization.

FOR GEMSTONES: Basically, if you consider yourself to be a good student, such as having good attendance, and can study well and connect certain materials and lessons together then you will be just fine. For those of you who are looking for a easy drive by, this is not the class. Couple pop quizzes, and his tests can have specific questions.

Really knowledgeable in his field. Tons of corny jokes. Not that bad if you get used to them. The lectures and labs are easy and fun, but the exams are pretty hard. You need to remember trivial details on the slides. There's NO MULTI-CHOICE. He's willing to help students. You can find him in his office on the third floor of the Mendenhall Lab.

This professor along with most of my Earth sciences courses did not use Carmen for grades. A matter of fact he not use Carmen/Canvas at all. He never used any online resources whatsoever! His lectures are long and he tends to drag on so it gets more difficult to focus in my opinion. Beware of exams! They are all written no multi-choice!

This is not a GE that you're going to be able to skate through, you have to actually go to class, take the pop quizzes & study. Babcock is a GOOD GUY. He wants all of his students to do well, and if you show him that you have studied & put in your best effort you will. As far as the book, I never bought it & was fine because I took good notes
If you ever find yourself in a class taught by Babcock immediately drop it. Immediately. Grades are completely arbitrary and nothing makes any sense.

I would not recommend this if you're just trying to get a general science out of the way. I thought this would be a fun, easy, GE but it turns out it was my worst grade of the semester- even after studying my butt off for both the final and midterm. He tests on trivial, unimportant details and those are pretty much your only grades.
Dont take this class this guys a grade a nut job. Horrible jokes super hard test for no reason  and 4 pop quizzes all semester worth 25 percent

Look here, I've always been really, really into gemstones, but this is the worst class I have ever taken in college. Everything he teaches is straight out of the textbook--- BUT, the 2 exam aren't! So there's 60% of your grade right there gone from something completely out of your control. PLEASE take a different Earth Science class !

If I were you, I'd do a quick google search of him and allegations against him. If you miss a pop quiz, your grade is tanked. His humor is unbearable. He changed the term project to be worth a measly 5%, so don't bother with anything too fancy. Lectures have the same material as the book--which is in the library reserve. Don't waste money on it.

Gemstones was an annoying GE to take. Loren Babcock didn't use Carmen & this class grade is basically weighted on a midterm & a final. The lectures are not mandatory but there were open note pop quizzes worth 5% of the final grade. The final was multiple choice but very specified. I was very surprised I didn't flunk the course after the final.

Started this class and thought Dr. Babcock was a cool and man was I wrong. He counts off for very petty things on exams and is totally not accessible to students. He doesn't even have an OSU email address. What should have been an easy A is now a solid C if I'm lucky. Material is easy, professor is terrible.

NEVER EVER TAKE GEMSTONES. Unless you want to memorize the whole textbook, save yourself from your own personal hell. I've never failed a class in my life until now. Find another science G.E. Nothing is on Carmen. There are no grades except the exams. Just save yourself.

You don't do anything in this class except for the pop-quizzes, midterm and final (which are your only grades so you have to ace). He shows up to class 10 minutes late everyday and then flies through the notes. He doesn't use carmen and doesn't use an email, so he's pretty much impossible to get a hold of. Don't know grade until final posting.

Professor Babcock seems to be knowledgeable in his field, yet this fails to translate to his teaching. Doesn't put course info/grades on Carmen and doesn't respond to emails so it is hard to know your grade/get help/etc. Exams are very specific and do not come from the in-class notes, like he claims. Worst teacher I've had -- do not take.
Doesn't clarify of what's on the exams. And the exams are tough and very specific

I'm sure he's a fine researcher, but he is a poor instructor. He does not put the class on Carmen. He wrote and priced his own textbook, and copyrights the slides so we can't use them. He tells us to study the information that is formatted on the slides, but doesn't provide them to us. Even then, the tests are more about trivial, specific examples.

Really nice guy. I feel like I learned a lot from this class, and I never found lecture too boring. The labs were actually usually pretty fun. His jokes are pretty terrible but you get used to them and they will eventually grow on you.
I liked Babcock. His bad jokes get old sometimes, but I believe he actually cares about his students. The class was not that hard and I actually learned a lot about interesting material.
He is a very horrible professor. You really cant understand what he most of the time because of the way he speaks

Prof. Babcock has horrible jokes. He is vague about what will be on exams. He often skips over open book quizzes designed to boost your grade. He mumbles alot.He rambles about pointless things. It's hard to stay engaged in class. My experience with Loren was not a happy one.
Excellent professor!!

Terrible. Horrible teacher. No help at all, huge jerk. Gives you little explanation of what will be on midterm and final. Avoid at all costs. No idea what everyone else is talking about- must be rating himself.

Excellent professor!!! Some of the material was a bit dense, but he made it interesting and fun.  Very knowledgeable in all areas of earth science, specifically geology. I highly recommend taking any class he offers. Funny jokes and great adventure stories too!!!

Probably the best Geology professors or any professor I ever had.  Everything was outlined and detailed in a very clear manner, which made review of material very easy.  I do recommend attending all of the classes, because there are helpful and interesting things that he adds that will help you remember the information. A++ instructor.

Horrible professor...horrible jokes...     Exams weren't extremely difficult but he would put information on them that he had never introduced in class and maintained that he had when asked about it.   Would only recommend this class to someone who can stand a barage of horrible 'Leno'-like jokes all qtr.

Is everyone joking? Only take this class if you have extreme patience. I couldn't stand his constant horrible jokes! He put something on the midterm he had never taught, and when 5 people asked him about it, he blew us off. Steer clear of this one, he is so obnoxious.

Dr. Babcock absolutely loves this class which makes it better in general. He is incredibly enthusiastic about everything. The midterm was easy if you studied, but I don't know about the final yet.  The best thing to do is go to every class and get all of his notes, that way you don't have to read the book. Definitely recommend this class for a GEC!
I enjoyed this class. Subject material was interesting compared to the average science class. Midterm and final were difficult, but there was a high curve. Definitely recommend this class for a GEC.
The labs for this class were great! Dr. Babcock is very passionate about his field and it shows in the classroom! I recommend this class for any GEC science.
Lectures are pretty interesting, his corny jokes help alot.  Class was easy, NO homework, and he basically told us what was on the midterm and final

made gemstones surprisingly interesting. science class for the not-scientifically-inclined. attendance not required except for labs. corny sense of humor, but in a good way. quite proud of his accomplishments in the field...
Good in class, keep away when not in class.
Great guy, knows everything you could want to know about gems and really enjoys teaching. Highly recomend the class.
Nice guy, knows a TON about the the whole field, Pretty easy to talk to, straight-forward exams, pretty interesting lectures if you're into the stuff.
Good teacher and a nice guy. He actually wants to help you learn. His jokes help you get through lecture and he is overall fair with grades. If you can, take a class from him--it's worth it.
Interesting class (gemstones). Got a bit boring at times, but his goofy jokes kept things amusing. He's a really nice guy and I would recommend him to anyone.
Corny jokes to help you remember things.  Always willing to help if needed.
No Comments
Great class with creative and exciting labs.  Lectures clear and amusing.
No Comments
Great teacher, helpful, clear. The labs are fun, and the lectures are engaging.

This professor is now a professor at the University of Delaware. He is a great guy, but his class is very disorganized. The semester is about to end and our grades have not been posted yet, our original syllabus was very vague and he claimed he would change it but has not changed it yet. Very few resources to study from.
Really nice and funny guy but easily the hardest GE I've ever taken. Didn't learn much either

I took this class for a GE. I would NOT recommend this class if you are looking for an easy GE. He is a great professor, but I think he is meant to teacher way higher level courses. He knows so much and the test ask specific questions when we have 80 slides per chapter. He is funny and really tries to help do what is best for the class.
Really enjoyed this professor, he really has a passion for inspiring students. Go to class because he will give pop quizzes and sometimes they are just an attendance check.

I did not enjoy Professor Chin's class. He is not funny, but he finds himself hilarious. He has this "I'm better than you and you better know it" attitude, and he is relentlessly offensive and persistent in engaging students in his lame tangents. He makes people feel stupid with his relentless random questioning. Not the hardest class,but not fun
He's a super nice guy. Really enjoyed lectures. Labs are somewhat boring.

Yu-Ping Chin is a good guy, but not a good professor. He moves so quickly through the powerpoints (which aren't even his, mind you) that it's nearly impossible to take notes. He covers a ridiculous amount of information for a 1000-level class and many of the classmates that I spoke with failed his midterm. Also gets distracted and runs on tangents

Professor Chin is a funny dude. He tries really hard to get the class engaged and excited about science, which I enjoyed. Exams are tough with tricky wording, but look very similar to the study guide he provides. He quickly lectures power points that he posts on Carmen after class. Oh, and I never even bought the book.

Although he is passionate about what he does, I would not suggest yu-ping or this class for GE credit. He will tell you how great he is and how great of a professor he is trying to be, but he flies through notes and alienates students with questions. Not a bad guy and tries to get class engaged. Just a terrible subject and misplaced confidence

Very interested in teaching and encourages students to think for themselves. He's hilarious and his lectures are always entertaining. A little tougher than the other professors for this class, but overall worth taking his section. Gives good reviews and practice problems similar to those on the actual exams.

Super detailed exam questions. He goes way too fast in lectures and you basically cant even take notes. He does care about what hes teaching and wants you to learn, but as a GE it is unreasonably hard for someone who is taking this because they have to. Stay away from this class with him.
Professor Chin is a great teacher. He is good at lecturing and makes this class interesting.
Can skip many classes and still pass as long as you get lucky with the pop quiz days. Reads straight off the slides and posts the annotated slides online after class.

Out of the 832 jokes he tries to make each lecture around 4 are funny. Is constantly badgering students for answers when they clearly don't want to talk. If you sit away from the isles you'll be fine. Only one midterm which had VERY specific questions. Labs are a breeze, but it's Not a guaranteed.
Travels everywhere known to man
Dr. Chin is hilarious and makes sure that you can apply the things you learn in class to real life.
tests are really easy, if u fail its definitely not prof chins fault your dumb. literally can coast thru class study 2-3 days before midterm and get a B or above

Yu Ping is a very entertaining professor, but I wouldn't recommend his class if you're trying to take an easy A GenEd. This course may be easy for Geology majors, but being a business major this was a hard class. He asks very specific ?s and the lecture slides are 100 slides long. Labs are easy. Take professor Douglas Alsdorf for the A.

I can't say enough great things about Yo. He's a great and fair professor, and he's hilarious. There is no reason not to take his section if you have the chance. He really cares about his students and their lives in and outside of the classroom.
he is hilarious, one of my favorite teachers i have had

Dr. Chin really cares about students and has a high level of respect for his class. He has a genuine interest in student success in and out of the classroom and does what he can to encourage students to think for themselves and make the class applicable to real life.
Yo Chin rules!! Such an entertaining professor for basic material. Explains everything clearly. His was my favorite class of the semester.

Dr. Chin is great! This class could get really boring, but Dr. Chin kept it as interesting as possible and threw in lots of jokes. He's very pro student and gives you a lot of opportunities for easy points. If you have take this class, take it with Dr. Chin.
Easily my favorite professor of all time. A truly infectious personality that is a joy to learn from. I highly recommend taking his class.

Yo was a good teacher.  Class consists of labs, 2 exams, and pop quizzes.  There is a curve in the class and I did way better than I thought I was going to.  Go to class and do well on your labs and you'll be fine. Not a difficult class just do the work!

Professor Chin is a very good teacher and is very interested in helping his students learn what he is teaching.  He keeps a good balance between his research and his teaching, and is genuinely interested in teaching.  He relates current events in with the class which helps to make things more relevant.  I would recommend him to anyone!
he's really funny. go to class

The comments left bashing this guy come from ignorant pessimists. I would take a teacher with his enthusiasm over some boring monotone genius any day. College is about what you put into it. If you haven't figured that out you will never graduate. Go to lecture, do the assignments, study, get an A. simple, Do work kid

I did most of the labs wrong, didn't show up for a quiz, didn't do a homework, never stayed for a whole lecture, and never studied for more than two hours, and i STILL got an A!! just stay long enough to make sure there's no quiz, and make sure you read the textbook.
He is one of the best prof I have ever had. He is the man.

He wasn't so bad.  He's genuinely interested in Geology.  He likes to rant and rave about how science funding has gone down the toilet in America, and fair enough, he's right.  I got a B in the class and I'm not sure exactly how, because I didn't do well on the first midterm.  Go to the review sessions and do every lab, you'll do fine.
awesome professor, he has a great sense of humor and interesting stories! the TA Chunjiang Yu is also great. I highly recommend taking a class with yo!!!  Yo is the man!
extremely nice and fair, always willing to help and answer questions.  Attendance isn't mandatory, but there are pop quizes.
Yo is the Man!

He cracks a lot of lame (sometimes funny) jokes and the course material kinda sucks, i mean the whole class is about rocks. But Chin gives you every chance to succeed.
