Great guy, gives quizes not exams, cept a final.  The quizes kinda suck, but he is really helpful and lab is easy as can be.  Not a lot of work involved.
Very nice guy, can get off topic during lecture but the class itself is quite easy and the testing is almost exclusively lecture material.

Exceedingly clear about what he expects, and an absolutely wonderful disposition. Tests primarily from lecture. You could conceivably attend every lecture, never read the text, and do very well. With good reason, I have taken more than one of his classes!
Very easy-going, friendly, and willing to help.  Lectures can be a bit disorganized and confusing, but not to the point of frustration.  I would recommend Dr. Pride.
I agree
good teacher, funny, very kind

Dr. Millan is very kind and caring towards her students. She is very passionate about her subject and this was evident in the high quality and informative lectures. Her grading criteria was very clear and fair. The Natural Disasters class is a 10/10.

She's super sweet but wouldn't recommend if you're looking for something laid back. It's pretty time consuming and very lecture heavy, and the lectures aren't super engaging so it's difficult to follow as someone with ADHD. It's not super difficult content, but very time consuming (and the lectures are hard to follow just because there's so many.)

There were weekly assignments and quizzes and occasionally the assignments would take me a while, but it was never anything unreasonable. Watching all the lectures were more time consuming than the assignments. There were a lot of lecture videos to watch every week and it was a but much, but everything on the quizzes was mentioned in the lecture.
took this class online and there was usually multiple lectures a week that were time consuming. the time on the quizzes was very short so you must watch the lectures to do well

Millan is one of the sweetest professors I've had and is truly an amazing person. The class started easy but got harder. No exams but the weekly quizzes sometimes have obscure questions that were only mentioned briefly in the lectures. Work load is totally manageable. Somewhat easy A as long as you watch lectures and do extra credit which.

Dr. Millan is genuinely super sweet but this class was a lot harder than it should have been for an intro class. The format would change weekly and sometimes the quiz questions didn't match what we learned which bring down your grade a lot since they were based on a few questions. She does give a lot of extra credit and is very sweet though!

She is a very sweet woman and her lectures are very clear. If someone is saying that this class is hard then they are simply not watching all the lectures. Overall, very easy class and would take again!.... After another couple weeks in the class I still think that she is a great woman, but her lectures will not have all the info for the quizzes :(

Do not take this class as a GE. Her grading and this class is ridiculously hard. She makes up random reasons for why she graded things a certain way. She gave me a 0 on an Extra Credit. I spent 4-5+ hours a week on content, and her lectures sometimes don't align with the quizzes, that are also very hard. Her grading is not consistent either.

I really enjoyed this class. The lectures were very entertaining and easy to follow. She gave blank powerpoint that you could use to take notes and there were many extra credit opportunities. The weekly quizzes are all very straightforward, and not difficult as long as you do the reading and watch the lectures. She is very helpful as well.

I thought this would be an easy GE class, but it was definitely hard. She posts so many lecture videos and the quizzes each week are actually hard. Thankfully I had a friend in the class or I would have not gotten an A. I wouldn't recommend if you are looking for an easy A gen ed class.

Honestly one of the best science classes I've taken. It's interesting and she is clearly passionate. If you actually watch the lectures, take notes using her handouts, and do the assignments, you'll be completely fine and will get a good grade. Didn't spend more than 4-5 hrs a week on this class, but learned A LOT. Really glad I took this class.

The class itself is pretty easy and shes a decent lecturer. The class has way too much content that is covered. Easily 2+ hours of lectures weekly plus lengthy assignments and quizzes every week. Never got a break during fall or Thanksgiving. I Spent more time on this class than any of my major classes. No tests. Not sure Id recommend if busy

Really well-organized asynchronous class that's a great GE choice. Lots of lectures and quizzes every week but as long as you fill out the powerpoints you will be fine. She is really interested in the content and it's apparent! Multiple extra credit opportunities. As long as you put in some effort it isn't too bad.

Gave homework on breaks. It seemed like she didn't care about giving us breaks when Ohio State said that homework was not to be given on week-long breaks like Thanksgiving. Her extra credit was also formatted differently. They were like assignments that affected our grade

Six-week online summer class so it was very condensed and there were a lot of lectures each week, but in return no assignments, only quizzes based on the lectures and reading. Sometimes the lectures took a while but are key for quizzes. She is very knowledgeable, and really cares about the topic and making sure students succeed.
I bought the textbook, but never really used it. Some of the quizzes are open book, however. She was very interested in her material which is certainly a good thing.

Best online class I've taken, she keeps lectures short and clear, breaks the weekly modules into pieces to make it easier to stay on track, and offers a lot of extra credit. She does everything she can to ensure her students succeed!

Lots of chances for extra credit so you shouldn't have an issue getting an A in this class, but there are tons of video lectures and little quizzes and you have to complete them ALL to finish the assignment and big quiz each week. No papers or exams though. Watch her lectures in 2x speed, trust me. Also kinda rude in her emails and doesn't care

AWESOME! Really cares about you and your grades. lots of extra credit. Keeps lectures short like 20 mins. Lots of assignments and quizzes, but they're easy for the most part. She's very kind and a fun person to listen to. She really cares and her class is really easy as long as you do the work. No midterm or final exam or papers.

Cristina was great! Her lectures were exciting and informational. Her quizzes are a bit hard, so make sure you take good notes with lectures and readings. I took this online and I didnt have any Finals or midterms. Loved the class

Overall, a pretty average class. The tests are maybe slightly harder than average, but not terrible. The class is very laid-back and Cristina is really nice. You can switch the average of your quiz grades for one of the exams, if it is a higher score. Not too many grades, just the exams, attendance, and labs. Exams come from lectures

Took gemstones expecting it would be an easy, fun GE and it was the hardest class ever. Studied for the final for over 40 hours and still ended up getting a B- on it.  Test questions are impossible, only way anyone would know all of them is if they're really lucky or a geology major.  Millan was never any help and didnt care when averages were low

if you want an easy A for a GE credit this isn't really for you. takes attendance every day, the material is pretty easy but the test are tough. one of those teachers that has multiple possibilities for each question so you have to pay attention to the little stuff. as a GE class, this was too much.

She is definitely passionate about what she does. Her accent can make it a little hard to understand a few words here and there, but for the most part she is clear. You take quizzes on an app after every unit and at the end of the semester you can replace one of your midterm grades with your average quiz grade. Pretty cool and not very hard.

I wish I loved anything as much as Cristina loves gem stones. You had to show up for participation grade. But if you skipped half of the classes it didn't really matter. All of her test came directly from the slides and were super easy. I paid attention in class and took notes. I only studied for an hour before each test , Super Easy class!

I took this class as a GE and after everyone having done fairly well on the first exam, she made the second one extremely difficult and worth more points. She goes on long tangents and expects you to remember minute details and problem solve complex situations that are often subjective. If you want an easy GE, don't take this course with her.

She is very passionate and well-informed about her subject. However, she goes through her contents at full speed; can be extremely confusing if you are falling behind.  Grade is solely based on tests.  Test questions are super specific; you need to pay attention to every word that came out of her mouth. A lot of extra credit opportunities.

Her class was a joke. I was told that this course was a interesting course for non majors in geology and that was a LIE! She was unorganized, when I tried to schedule appts with her she was never there or on time or forgot she had a meeting. NO HOMEWORK to weight out any exam grades. Class is based off EXAMS! Not good for ppl with test anxiety!

She is not helpful at all. She does not understand where students are coming from when they have an issue in the class. She thinks everyone loves gemstones and acts like we should spend all of our time devoted to her class. I thought this would be an interesting semi easy class. I WAS WRONG. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!

Not as bad as the comments lead you to believe... Don't waste your money on the book. I never opened mine. She gave "recoup" points after each exam. Quizzes are random but they are group work. One midterm can be replaced be the quiz average. I hate science so it was a decent GEC for my science section.

She is an amazing teacher, She is very passionate about her study and helps the students very well. She doesn't care about grades, she cares about the students learning. If you pay attention and come to class instead of JUST reading the book its a garuntee good grade.. For our midterms she lets us retake the most missed questions.

I liked Prof. Millan and I loved her class.  She is passionate about teaching and I learned alot.  She was very helpful and I felt she responded to everyone's questions with much knowledge.  Her class is not easy but she makes us think and I think people here are just cry babies that want everything given to them like we are in elementary school!

Cristina Millan is terrble teacher. she has nothing to say when you ask her specific questions. goes to fast you have to "keep up". she was NOT available by email before a FINAL, but she never responds anyway. she was unorganized, and it was hard to know what to study for the quizzes in her class... which we we only took half of them anyway.

Wow. what a horrible teacher. Tests were over material we've never learned and she posts a study guide that says "in no particular order" -_- makes it extremely difficult to do well on any exams, and even when the averages are bad she has nothing to say about it.

The class was interesting, and she seemed to be a decent teacher during the lectures, but her tests were ridiculously hard, often featuring material we had never learned.  The group quizzes we had every week or so were nice though.

Millan seemed interested in teaching and the subject, but the lectures and material were unorganized. The quizzes and tests were way too specific for a 100 level course. The lack of organization definitely makes studying for the exams difficult.

Hated her with a passion. A horrible lecturer. She wasted so much time yapping about topics that we weren't to be tested on. Quite difficult for a 100 level GEC course. I wouldn't suggest taking it...
Good lecturer, but didn't seem prepared for any questions of substance. She was interesting, but soft-spoken. Tests ad quizzes seemed a bit too specific for a 100 course.

Was a great professor and would definitely take a class with him again. Made it super easy and fun with a few demonstations throughout the class. Honestly felt like he enjoyed teaching and helping others.

Professor Mumper was one of the few teachers I had that had really amazing lectures and is clearly very passionate about what he does. A few papers but they aren't too bad. His class was great. Only thing that could get annoying is I don't like politics and he brought up a bit politics a bit but overall I think that he was a great teacher.

One of the most passionate professors I've had. There is quite a bit of homework but most of it is pretty easy, mostly discussion posts, you just have to keep track of it. A couple of papers which weren't too bad. Let us use a note sheet on the final which was very helpful.

Dr. Mumper is very passionate about his teaching and makes you really think about your actions and care about what you're learning. He is a bit disorganized with dates and such, but overall he is really good. His class is pretty easy if you do the assignments and go to the lectures.

Dr. Mumper was by far one of the best professors I have ever had. He cares about the subject, is passionate about his work, and is very funny. The assignments were simple & allowed you to take what you learn and apply it to other material. He truly wants the best for his students & for them to understand the material not just know it. 13/10

Genuinely one of the best professors I have every experienced. Mumper teachers what he loves and that is so clear in his lectures. He is hilarious and keeps you listening even when it can be a mundane topic. The assignments are simple, although can be a little hard to read(thats science though.) An amazing person who makes an even better teacher.
Very fun teacher and I learned a lot from him. His class is very well structured and as long as you pay attention to the lectures you should have no problem on any of the tests.

Dr. Mumper is very passionate about what he teaches. He does his best at making sure that his students understand the material that is taught in class. He does tend to talk a bit fast when he is lecturing and I personally felt that his tests were a bit difficult. But overall, I felt that Dr. Mumper was very good.
I am by no means a Science mind and Professor Mumper made me enjoy this science course and really made the material easy to grasp and understand. Great sense of humor and very honest. 10/10 recommend
Such a great teacher. Exams are easy and he truly cares about all his students. Definitely take him if you can!

You can tell that Eric cares about the subject a lot, and his passion made otherwise repetitive topics interesting! Told lots of self-depricating jokes, really wanted to give him a hug most days. The class should be an easy A if you attend lecture, do the weekly quizzes, and go to review sessions for the exam. Exams are super straight forward.

Interesting and makes you want to travel. Material is usually simple + repeats; I've zoned out on occasion. A big highlight is Eric's personality and humor- he's really lovable, friendly and relatable. Passionate and one of my favorite professors- even did demonstrations. Only wish he would have done that outdoor lecture that he was thinking about!
Eric is very reasonable and the class is definitely manageable. The overall class Is filled with Interesting content. Random attendance points.

Was not in this class, however, I went to half of his lectures because I just showed up for my friend who was actually enrolled in the class. He is an amazing instructor with a very dry sense of humor and he makes jokes about his sad life and I want to give him big ol' hug because I love him; he is very passionate about the course. 10/10 recommend

Professor Mumper is great. He is hilarious and relatable with a self-deprecating sense of humor. You can tell he puts in a lot of effort and he is very knowledgeable about his subject matter. He also is willing to answer any questions, and if he doesn't know the answer, he looks it up and gets back to you. Definitely had a low-key crush on him :)

Funny guy. Easy A if you give any effort. Weekly quizzes/homework that are easy. Exams are straight forward and easy if you attend lecture (attendance is graded randomly). Definitely recommend taking his class!

Quirky guy, but could be funny.  Random attendance throughout the semester so be sure to show up.  Exams weren't tough as long as you studied what he told you to in the study guide.  Extremely passionate about what he teaches, even though it could get pretty dry.
Insecure and funny. Allowed for extra credit and was suuuuper repetitive

Class had three professors who split the work, I'm just posting it under Bevis as he's listed first. One of the easiest four credit hour classes you could take, and it's also one of the worst organized college classes I've taken. You'll do one assignment a week at most, but be prepared for badly made exams and lectures that don't have a purpose.

Bevis himself was pretty good and knows a lot about what he teaches. He is very lecture heavy with slideshows though and not much else. The ES1911 class is odd with having 3 different profs, and I was not a fan of the quizzes as not many people I talked to really knew what was going to be on them. But Bevis is the best out of the 3 though for sure.

1911 has 3 professors and can be taken as a bio/physical science/history GE. He covers the physical science portion of 1911. No tests just quizzes after every lecture (easy if you pay attention). Gets boring sometimes. Bulk of the grade comes from a group poster project and individual history essay. He has an accent and does research in Greenland.

This was a climate change class and it was incredibly boring material but he liked to add some dry humor in as well. This class was taught by 3 professors (each for one third of the semester) and though i struggled to stay awake during his class, as long as i showed up and paid a little bit of attention, i was fine!

Very dry sense of humor, really funny if you get him. The book is useful if you miss class, read the chapter that lecture is over and your good. BEWARE OF OBSCURE FACTS! Test always had random facts like the temp. of magma, the kind of thing you would skip over if you read it. His teaching partner is kind of boring.

Great sense of humor, cool accent, and super great teacher.  Would take another class from him anytime.  He was wonderful at explaining things.  Natural Hazards 151 is an easy A.  Just pay attention in lecture, you don't need the book. He lets you take tests, discuss them with classmates, and take them again for the average! Overall: Good guy!

This guy is a great person.  He teaches you how to think about concepts.  The class was very informative, however you need to understand a bid of math to be comfortable with what he teaches.  I seriously recommend him as a graduate advisor.  Has a great sense of humor.  The school need more professors like him.

Dr. Thompson is clearly not a scientist but an explorer that has used many knowledgeable colleagues and people to reach targets that he would never have fulfilled by himself because of his deep technical and scientific incompetence. He became a millionaire teaching a class every other year thanks to the support of unethical administrators at OSU.

Despite his fame Prof. Lonnie Thompson is a real incompetent. For instance he does not know the difference between statistical indexes such as average and median. His ethic is low at best. Prof. Thompson is only apparently an humble person. He is used to say: "It is important to appear humble as people like humble persons".
Very weak professor with no personality and no ethics.

Dr. Lower is absolutely wonderful. He was nothing but kind to his students and his lectures honestly weren't that boring. He made it interactive and talked in a way that made the material come off as interesting. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but he scatters attendance quizzes in throughout the course to insure you're still coming to most classes.

Very caring and funny guy. Super helpful. Did attendance quizzes that related to his lectures, but attendance was not mandatory. He is awesome, just study the notes and go to class when you can. He definitely wants to help his students succeed, and cares about you and your retention of knowledge rather than just a grade.

Dr. Lower is a great prof and genuinely cares about students. Exams were only tough b/c of the time limit, and lectures sometimes drug on, but he often lets us out early. Stay engaged and you'll do perfectly fine. He genuinely cares about students and goes out of his way to prove it--you can tell he really wants his students to learn and succeed!

Lectures can be a slog sometimes, I fought to stay awake frequently during the hour long sessions, but the content is interesting enough. Professor Lower is a great guy, and if you take this class you should try to attend as much as you can, because I found the tests to be pretty difficult. He offers recorded lectures that he hosts live on zoom.
Fantastic professor. 0 complaints. Chill, simple, easy follow, no tough at all. Never get a sense that this professor needs to prove something. Would take again 100 times.
Professor Lower is the most understanding professor and loves his students.
Best professor to start college with. He really cares about students and their grade.
It's a boring class, professor is nice though.

Extremely informative class that doesn't require much work. We did weekly quizzes and then two open note exams that are straightforward. The class usually requires a small research paper or poster (depends on the semester). It effects your grade a lot, so don't put it off. I found his lectures easy and he says what will be on the exam every lecture

Pretty boring class, especially if you've taken enviro classes in high school. It was easy though and a good introduction. If you're taking this class as a GE, definitely recommend Prof. Lower since it's an easy A and attendance isn't mandatory. However, if you want to be engaged in the topic I would maybe go elsewhere.

Great guy. Interesting class too. Go to class because some of the slides he posts online, he removes some information so that the people who go to class have the advantage. Would definitely take again. Dont underestimate the exams. Theyre not a cake walk despite being online and open note.

In terms of a science GE lab class, I highly recommend. He really wants to see you succeed and it's relatively an easy class. Labs are easy-ish, just time consuming. Lectures aren't mandatory and on Carmen but sometimes he has "attendance quizzes" that will be used in your final grade. The tests are open book/note and taken on carmen. Not too bad.

Earth Science is a great GenEd class. Super easy and interesting. Professor Lower gives out tons of extra credit if you go to lecture. There are attendance quizzes but he gives the answers in lecture, sometimes even takes the quiz during lecture. Exams are super easy, online, and open note. Lab is also extremely easy.

Professor Lower is really charismatic, but his lectures can still get dry. Going to class is important because he puts things from lecture on the exams that aren't in the powerpoint notes. He gives extra credit for participating in class, so do that! I would recommend him, he's a nice and intelligent guy.

Hes not a bad lecturer, its just a boring class (to me at least). His exams were harder than I thought, so prepare a bit for them (dont just look up the answers in his powerpoints). He does attendance quizzes but doesnt tell you when. Gives a lot of extra credit during class for participation. The lab portion is an easy A

Great Professor, and gives extra credit throughout the class for answering questions he throws out during lecture. The exams are online but were harder than expected, you are allowed to have your notes but I would recommend studying as if you don't have notes to be prepared. Attendance is not mandatory but he gives quiz answers in lecture sometimes

Prof Lower's class is a fantastic option for a GE. He is hilarious, engaging, and the info is interesting and simple. Just don't forget to go, pay attention and do the quizzes, as they will help your grade. I didn't find the test to be hard at all as long as you have the info in front of you, which is allowed. Labs are simple if a bit boring .

Pretty cool guy, had a great sense of humor. Classes aren't mandatory, but he will sometimes do attendance quizzes. Exams we're harder than expected, but he posts his slides on Carmen. Labs are super easy, you're allowed to miss one. He gives out extra credit in lectures for easy questions & if you get the question wrong he still gives it to you

Professor Lower made this otherwise irrelevant GenEd required course interesting and engaging. He gives extra credit points counted towards your midterm or final often during lecture for answering questions ranging from somewhat difficult to ridiculously obvious. Great teacher, very approachable and down to earth.

Lower is difficult to follow. He jumps back and forth through slides. Offers bonus points in class if you participate, but rewards wrong answers more than correct answers. He dumbs down the material, but the open note, online exams are much more completed, random and over things not even discussed in class.  Exams pretty much determine grades.

This was a really easy GE! As someone who is not a fan of science,  Lower made this class endurable. GO TO LECTURES. He gives a lot of extra credit just for being there. Exams are online, but make sure to review material prior.  He's a super nice guy and was extremely helpful if you ever needed it! Easy A with extra credit and minimal studying.

TAKE THIS CLASS! You won't be sorry. Dr. Lower is funny and provides an interesting lecture for the content this class covers. No textbook, and open-note exams. Go to class, pay attention and you will do fine. The lab is pretty easy, and only meets once a week, usually finished before the scheduled end time. Study for exams and you'll get an A.

Dr. Lower is great. The class consists of an easy lab, attendance quizzes (answers given, reading quizzes, midterm, and a final. The reading quizzes are tremendously easy. The exams are not bad if you somewhat study. They are open note so you should get good grades on both. The lectures are awesome and he gives out participation extra credit.

The lecture material is super easy and the examples done during class are very simple. However, the exams are almost impossible. He doesn't give you enough time to give each question the necessary thought and most of the questions aren't covered in class. He also misdirects you to what kind of questions will be on the exams.
The assigned reading quizzes and exams were so so hard. Class was so much simpler than the exams were. He makes this class so hard for no reason, it is a GE. I would never take this again.

Professor Lower is by far the funniest teacher I've had. He makes the class more interesting than it actually is. Labs are extremely easy. He gives out easy extra credit points for participation in class. RAISE YOUR HAND FOR THE EXTRA CREDIT because there is a very good chance you will not do as well as you would like on the midterm/final.
He is a great professor! 10/10 would recommend his class. I hate science classes, but actually made my class very enjoyable. He is super funny and gives out easy extra credit points.
Exams are extremely difficult!!!

He went incredibly fast and jumped around on his slides a lot.  Then would delete certain info from them before he posted them online.  So if you didn't get very specific info down fast good look on the test, because he test questions are very specific.  Tests mainly graphs that were difficult to read than any vocal or concepts.  wouldn't recommend

Don't be like me. Go to class even though class is boring and way too long. Also this class has way too much math and just because the exam is open note and online doesn't mean this class wont rail you. I have no further advice other than take an easier lab class. Good day!

I felt he was difficult to follow in lecture-he would jump around the slides in the powerpoint which made it kind of difficult to take notes. His exams are online, but  are pretty difficult  for the content of the class and some questions are very detailed. Lab and lecture aren't really related.

Great professor, super nice and gives out easy extra credit points each lecture. Labs are easy, and he relates the lecture to what we learn in lab which I really liked. His online quizzes and tests are super hard but they are open book so it's manageable. Would recommend, he brought humor to the class and made learning enjoyable.
He was a pretty great professor. He's very motivated with his research too and will mention it in class from time to time.

I missed one online quiz and it brought me from an A- to a B+, it was stupid because I simply forgot about it. The reading tests are hard. But if you go to class he will give you answers to his online quizes. Nice guy to not let the final be cumulative. Labs are easy but useless and do not do the same things classes do.

Professor Lower is a very knowledgeable and straightforward guy who takes a textbook-free approach to the course. All content is learned in lecture through powerpoints and all quizzes and exams are online (open-note); he pulls most exam questions from powerpoint slides. Lab is a joke, but an easy A. Overall great professor and interesting class.

Very easy class to take. Has super easy quizzes, no homework and no papers. The labs are not harshly graded. You shouldn't skip the lectures because he goes over a lot of stuff but you can pass  even if you do. Pay attention to every detail and readlisten to all the supplemental material. Tests are open note, open book.
Honestly, a good teacher with an interesting class. But it just isnt worth taking because the tests are just too difficult. A- but I needed an A

Very good professor. I don't know why test averages were a B. I had no trouble getting A's on the exams. I only got a B + on the final and that is because I did not study at all. All lectures are posted online. Labs easy boost to everyones grade. Only reason to go to class is pop quizzes. Lots of extra credit if go to class also.

Great guy. Funny, very intelligent. Very helpful & open to questions. Loves when you speak up, may give you random extra credit. Lectures are dry, but Dr. Lower is entertaining! Exams...I always expected to do much better but for some reason couldn't get above a B! But pretty straight forward class, all notes on carmen.

Professor Lower is a nice guy. The class is super easy, but his tests are harder than they have too be. He doesn't care about teaching this class and will talk about his research of bacteria a lot. He puts all of his slides on Carmen. You have to do a research project at the end, not worth it if its just a GE credit.
Great professor. Repeats himself numerous times to make sure you comprehend. Gives out lots of extra credit. Go to lecture and take notes and you will get an A.

I took this class because I heard that it is super easy. I went to lectures, took notes, studied, and when the tests came around they were impossible. It is a 100 level class but he makes it so hard. He was so cocky. The labs were a joke and saved my grade.

All was fine except the way he wrote his tests.  Example of a bogus question from an exam: "We tested a hypothesis related horoscopes during lecture. Suppose we conduct the test again using 13 signs and 13 horoscopes.  Professor Lower would predict that ______% of students will select the correct horoscope in the new test with 13 signs?".
Awesome prof, direct and straight to the point.  Exams are all multiple choice, and final is composed of many of the exact same questions on first two midterms.

This class was not really difficult, most people average a B. But Professor Lower made it clear that he did not really care about teaching. He repeatedly said "I know you all have better things to do with your time than come to class and so do I." Extremely focused on research; class seemed like an afterthought to him.
Hes great. Is really clear about what you need to know. most people avg a B on his exams, lab and pop quizzes boost your grade

he makes this class so easy, everything on the test is exactly what is in class, especially the overhead slides he does. i loved the class and it was a nice break in comparison to my other classes... take this class if you want A

The easiest class ive taken at OSU thus far and its my 3rd yr. You must go to class though cuz the test are exactly from what he says in class. If you cant at least get a B in this class i dont know how you got into OSU

He's legit. Most people (avg.) get a B in this class. Labs are ridiculously easy but are 25% of your grade. The material on Planet Earth is really not that interesting but he actually tries to teach and gives out bonus points for participating. Really real and down to earth -- he doesn't seem to care about teaching but is actually not bad at it.

Do you need an A? with as little work as possible. then this is the class.....you must attend this lectures because everything is going to come from the slides (I mean everything 100%) plus you get 10 free points when you attend the class. Final had similar questions from MT-1 and 2...he let us bring note card to the 2nd one...Must take... 10/10

Im not sure what class everyone else took, but his exams are ridiculous.  NOthing to do with the lecture note, tons of calculations he never tells you how to do.  I have a 3.86 and im pretty sure I will do really poorly in his class
Fair. You don't need to buy the book. His exams can be extremely difficult if you don't study. Class is pretty boring, but he tries.

Dr. Lower is an amazing professor all around. He has a very laid back type of teaching style, but you learn an incredible amount in just one quarter. His exams can be tricky, so read carefully! Make sure to go to lecture because his exams are based on lecture notes, not reading in the book. As long as you study your notes, you will love this class!

Great Teacher. Explains things well and he makes sure you know the material. Exams are based entirely on Lecture so you have to go to class (doesn't post notes on Carmen). Test are easy if you have the notes. He looks like John Mayer. haha

He is a great professor and makes the material really easy to learn.  His tests for the most part are easy but he throws in questions that he knows 98% of the class will miss.  He's arrogant and doesn't seem like he cares too much about teaching...he just happens to be good at it.
Easy class, but I don't feel like I learned anything at all really. Lectures were not as exciting as everyone says.

I have no interest in geology, but I found Dr. Lower's lectures pretty interesting. He spells out everything for you! On the exams there are some questions where he tries to trick you, so just read carefully. I never opened my book, so don't bother buying it. Labs are stupid, but easy. A great professor for an easy A in a physical science course.
Great teacher!  The class was very easy.  He makes his tests right from class notes and there was no need to buy the book.  Labs were really boring though.

Take this man! He really is easy and he cleary states what he wants on every exam. He gives you 10% by just going to class. His exams are extremely easy esp if you go to class.  He was really interesting and i would take anything that he is teaching. So, take him and you wont regret it

Dr. Lower is probably one of the best professors I have ever had. He made the material seem less boring and kept the students engaged. He gives ec for participating, hints to exams in lecture, and easy attendance quizzes- so GO TO CLASS. The final is 90% of the midterms and he posts those answers before hand. Def. take his class!

I thought that geology was going to be a drag but he makes it so interesting.Its not just looking at rocks, its how the earth works and stuff.lecture is actually interesting, tests are easy cause he gives you hints in class, go to class and its an easy A, doesn't use the book, usually lets out early, REALLY easy! some extra credit if u participate
hes soo easy and awesome
Superb professor.  Really interested in teaching students.
Exceptional professor!  Best I've ever had.
Excellent teacher, actually kept me awake. No tricks, just straight forward.

Your grade just depends on whether or not you go to class. He doesnt use the textbook so dont buy it. His notes for the tests come straight from his lectures so you have to go in order to get these notes. 2 midterms and a final. Tests consist of about 35 multiple choice and an essay. He'll tell you what the essay will be before the test.
No Comments
Very weak professor with lack of ethic.

This is the easiest Physical Science GE (with a lab) to take at OSU! Lecture is not mandatory, however it is nice to go so you're not completely lost. All quizzes and midterms/finals are online and are open web/note which makes this class an EASY A!!! Would recommend to anyone looking to knock a science credit out that is not a science major.

This, I swear, was the most easiest class I have ever taken. Honestly, such an easy class with no work except show up to the labs. All exams and quizzes online with MULTIPLE attempts. You can literally google all the questions and BAM! u have an easy A. Great class to take if you are trying to balance a bad grade from another class.

Really easy class. All tests are online, and we were allowed to take them three times. Make flashcards. He's pretty easy on the students. Lecture isn't mandatory, but he does give pop quizzes every once in a while for attendance. Prof. Howat is funny and nice, but the class is pretty boring. Good GE class.

This class is an easy A. The labs are easy and I got an A on all of them. There are three midterms and a final. All of them are online, and each one you get three attempts on. This class is more about how fast you can Google the answers for the test, than it is memorizing anything. Everyone should take this as an easy GE.

I mean this sincerely, if you cannot at least pull a B in this class, you're doing something wrong. Hands down the easiest class I've taken at OSU. Ian knows you're not wanting to be a geologist. If you need a science course with a lab, this is the one.

OK so he tries hard to be interesting. But its pretty boring stuff! He's a good teacher though and will answer your questions. He gives a huge exam packet - do it! your questions come straight from that. I didn't do it (lazy) and got a B. Labs are really easy too and you can drop two.
Several questions are posted that could be possible exam questions, answer and memorize those because the exam questions come straight from that. Fairly easy class, that's somewhat interesting.

Test questions are mostly online, do them weekly then study them! all resources on Carmen and very organized.  Kind of an ass in lectures, but as long as you don't need personal assistance, he's a great professor.  If you have a personal problem in class, talk to your TA.  Labs are interesting and the majority of your grade.  Good GEC choice.

This class requires good memorization skills. Test questions are put online.  You are responsible for finding the answers to many possible test questions.  Labs are very easy and kind of fun.  Not a bad GEC if you are looking for an A or a B
Very interesting, knows what he's talking about, all the questions that he uses for his exams he puts online and they are all multiple choice, easy class

Ian is one of the best teachers I've had at OSU. He makes some really boring stuff interesting. I just took this class because I needed the GEC, but I ended up really getting into it and wish I majored in geology. Ian's the man. Take this class.

Only study the past exam questions. Go to lecture, pop quizzes are worth a good chunk of your grade and the answers are given to you. Textbook use is good for the questions. If you're good at memorizing, you'll do fine.

Ian is a super cool guy who makes the not-so-interesting information of the course as interesting as possible. He tries to make it fun and makes everyone feel comfortable with his easy-going nature. LOTS of material but the pop quizzes are just completion and he gives you the questions to exams beforehand.

Great teacher, come to class and study for 5 hours before each test and you will do fine. Attendance isn't mandatory, however he gives in class pop quizzes that aren't worth much. I highly suggest this class/ professor.
Great teacher!!!!!!!

I was in Ian's first class in his first year teaching at OSU. He is a really nice guy and the class was really cool. He is really interested in helping students, and makes the information really accessible. (all his powerpoints that he uses in class are incredibly detailed and are posted online prior to class.) labs were really cool too!

Ian is a cool teacher. His exams are really easy, as long as you pay attention in class and read a little bit outside of class. He gives you all the questions to the exams and you are responsible for the answers, he will not give them to you- until after the exam. Overall, very very good teacher that knows what he is talking about!

Although Dr. G is a great lecturer, beware of this class's difficulty. The first exam's average was a 56%, and was said by her to be the 'easiest'. The questions were so ridiculously particular and unfair, given a straightforward class material. It absolutely is NOT worth the GE credit, there is much easier options.

Professor Grottoli was a very good professor and I can see why a lot of people liked her. I thought taking this class would be an easy GE class as she drops many assignments from your grades, but people did not mention that there are 4 exams in this class. I dropped after the first exam in week 3, as the average score on the exam was a 56%.

The content covered is really interesting and Grottoli is truly passionate about teaching. She does go into depth over some of the material but it's overall pretty easy. She drops a test, 5 quizzes/reflections, and 1 paper. She's also super caring for her students. Recommend for an easy GE.

Grottoli is a really cool professor and she's super passionate about what she teaches. That being said, she does expect a lot from you for an intro class. Lectures are fast and thorough and she can be impatient if you ask questions she thinks you should already know the answer too. Don't take this class if you tend to struggle with science.

This professor was so-so I can see why people liked her. Tests are mostly written essay questions but I believe she still does an open book portion which helps. Some questions are up to you to answer like answer "3/4 of the following questions" type of exam, which is nice so you can focus on what you know more

Dr. Grottoli was incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about this subject which made the class interesting. However, she made the exams incredibly difficult. It was hard to do well on her exams because they were really specific for a gen ed course. I would not recommend this class.
Fair grader, made you go to the lectures to fill in info on the slides, were pretty interesting lectures.   Tests were hard but all multiple choice, be ready to study everything on the power points.

Dr. G is a very intelligent professor. Her class was interesting and I normally don't enjoy science classes being a business major. Although it was challenging it was worth it. She gives some extra credit but as long as you go to lectures you should be fine. She really enjoys teaching the class and makes an effort to get to know everyone.

I took intro to oceanography & found it challenging. If you don't go to class, you have to get notes from someone who did which is hard to do. Dr G is very smart but a little condescending when you ask questions. I thought her lectures were fast paced so I got the book and it helped a lot. I thought she was too in depth. I wouldn't take it again.

Dr. Grottoli's lectures are pretty interesting even though they can be long. She says flat out what is going to be part of the short answer/ fill in the blank while lecturing. Her exams are not bad either half closed and half open book. A She gives the class a five minute mind break where you can stand up, talk.
Way too in depth for an intro class. Expects you to know ridiculous things and amounts of material

Took her for both EarthSci 1100 and Oceanography. Favorite Teacher at OSU. Extremely engaging to the class and loves to talk about her research with Coral Reefs. Definitely would take her class again! Tests are from the concepts she goes over in lecture and not on anything in the book, so as long as you attend lecture and listen you will do well.
Snooty at first. A lot of information to put out, and not easy to figure out what was on the test. Very hard to reach during office hours. I would not recommend.AVOID!

For a science GEC, material was rather in depth, but with bonus points and other extra credit, very easy to get an A (56% of class got A- or above). Prof was sometimes rather snooty and rude; not my cup of tea.
Not the most helpful. Make sure you go to every class b/c she puts the notes on carmen but leaves some parts blank and you will miss info and getting the notes from others was a pain.
Take this class! She is GREAT professor. I learned a lot. The lecture is interestin/fun, and she always give chance to raise your grade. The lab is pretty easy too. Just take it!
Extremely interesting!

A very good teacher, she takes her time to explain all the slides and uses a lot of graphs which helps with the material. All test material comes from her slides so buying the text book is not necessary. The tests aren't easy but the grading scale is fair and the top 1/3 of the class receives an A. I highly recommend her for this class.
the lecutres were extremely boring but she was very nice. tests are hard but the grading scheme for oceanography works to your favor. lab accounts for much of your grade and is not difficult at all!
She LOVES to call on people when she thinks they're not paying attention. She will randomly ask you obscure questions that she knows you do not know the answer.

Ugh... she really irritated me! She made a not-very-difficult subject seem VERY difficult. She crams as much information as possible into her two hour lectures and acts very obscure questions on the exams. The class averages were low and lectures were extremely boring.
She was super nice, a good lecturer.

his lectures are pretty boring but the exams are easy. exams are online and he gives out test answers if attendance is bad. there is a five page paper due towards the end of the semester but you can write about anything weather related so it is not hard.

The class lectures are very boring, but the class is very easy. Open note midterms and final, and lowest midterm is dropped. Attendance isn't mandatory, but when attendance is low he will give out midterm or final answers. There is a final paper but you get to pick the topic and truly doesn't require that much work.
Very boring lectures. Midterms are open notes so it requires very little work. I didn't learn anything but it could be an easy GE for those who just want an easy grade.

Not the most demanding class ever but just super boring. His lectures put me to sleep more than once. The midterm and the final were 50% which is annoying. He grades leniently and has a grading scale that ensures you pass the class. The labs were pretty straightforward, but I think that was due to the TA.

As with most science professors Ive experienced here at OSU, Dr. Barton has a lot of interesting stories to tell. I enjoyed his class a lot, and it was not difficult at all. Labs were leniently graded. Attend lectures because he drops exams hints frequently and sometimes takes attendance for EC. There is a term paper, but you can pick the topic.
Easy class, just make sure you stay on top of it. Also the labs were fun as well.
Has a good sense of humor! Lectures are definitely interesting and you're always learning something new. The final essay is an easy A!

This class has of 3 midterms (the lowest dropped) and a final. The class takes the test once and then we take it again after talking about it with the people next to us. You also write a short paper about a natural hazard. He is a very kind professor who is passionate about earthsci, lectures sometimes get boring but he can give out test answers.

Lectures are very boring but are posted online to view later if you fall asleep. Take an exam by yourself and then take a group exam, he averages the score between the two. Went to class maybe 4 times and ended with a high B, but be aware he gives out test answers if nobody shows up to class. 4 midterms, one paper

Dr. Barton is a helpful professor and he is really friendly. The exams are easy to get a nice grade if you study for that. You can talk with your group and professor about the answers during the exam. Overall it is easy to get an A.
Not an easy ge class, but easy science class. A lot of memorization.
Perfect GE class, really enjoyed the class. Easy to get an A

Took this for a GE, while it's not the easiest A ever, it's still an easy class. Boring lectures. He doesn't give A-'s so anything 90%+ is an A. I never read the book, skipped fairly often and just studied the lecture slides before exams. One simple paper. Noncumulative exams, lowest dropped, and you get to discuss answers and then retake the exam.

Took this class for an easy GE, was not easy. He allows you to retake exams as a group, but they are pure memorization and no learning involved. The exam questions are very specific, about small, insignificant things on the slides. He will lecture for over an hour and just read slides, it is extremely boring. Will drop one exam grade.

He lets you retake the exact exam after talking to a group for 30 min, and then averages the scores. However, because of this, he makes the exam extremely difficult. So you fail the first exam and do well on the second. He asks nit-picky questions that no one would think to study. It's basically straight memorization, not actual learning.

Took this for a GE and am not a science person - highly recommend if you are in my shoes. Four tests based on lectures he posts online. He let's you take it a second time with a group and averages the two, and drops your lowest average test at the end of the semester. You also get lots of points from easy labs and one short research paper.

I took this class to fulfill a GEC thinking it would be fairly easy as an intro level class, but I thought wrong. He stands at the front of class reading from slides for the entire lecture and the slides include so much information it's difficult to know what to study. One of those professors that expects a lot given the course is introductory.

Took this as a GE in a 4 week session. He is a very interesting and cool person the UK (yes a British accent) that for some reason kept my attention in a class that has some boring material to learn. Labs were graded very easy and you take exams twice one normal and the next after you discussed the questions and answers with peers. Would take again

Dr. Barton does indeed have a cool accent. His test questions can be very specific, but if you attend lectures and look at the PowerPoints, you should be fine. He does have you take each exam twice, lets you discuss the answers & averages the 2 scores. When over half the class doesn't attend a lecture he gives out test answers. Labs are quite easy.

I never went to this class and passed. He's a nice guy, but VERY boring to listen to in class. Lectures seem long because of this. Everything is on power point slides and he posts them on Carmen. 3 exams including a final. No homework. Tests aren't too bad if you study the slides. You take the tests twice and converse with your peers. Easy A!
This class was beyond easy. Group tests, everything straight from the powerpoint. Labs are easy. Anyone who didn't get an A in this class probably didn't try. Dr. Barton is a nice guy too.

Dr. Barton really knows his stuff. Lectures are long but full of info. Let's you take the exam, discuss it, and retake then averages the two. Pretty lenient grader, always a great curve. Never gotten below an A with him. Just make sure you put in the effort and time to study or you won't do well. And pick your lab partners carefully.

I take the class for may session. The professor is a really good person and he is interesting. There is no attendance for lecture. The labs are really interesting. Just review all power point would help you to get A.  I learn a lot from that class. I strongly recommend this class!

I love this guy. I find his class interesting, but I'm an environmental major so that's why. He does everything he can to get his students the best grade. I recommend going to class. If you mildly pay attention and go over the power points before exams you will do fine. Definitely one of the finest OSU has.

Doesn't use the book... The material is pretty intense and the tests are pretty hard, drops the lowest score and you take the test once, discuss it, then take it again. He averages the two scores together. The tests being so hard made me nervous about my grade, but, I ended with an A. He's an awesome guy too with a sweet accent.

Seems like this professor loves the subject he teaches. To the rest of us, the subject can be extremely boring and dull. But if you just show up to class and review the slides, you should be fine on the midterms. Midterms are easy- you get to take them twice and can discuss with those around you in between the two tries.

I loved this class. Barton grades fairly and has an incredible [British] accent. Don't buy the book; pretty much everything you need to know is on the slides. And show up to class: if attendance is poor, you might get answers for the next exam.
Class was super easy if you went every time and mildly paid attention. Plus he has a boss accent.
So funny. Love the accent!

Great prof. Passionate. Curves grades in favor of class majority. Would recommend summer course. All right labs but awesome TA and fun group of partners to work with. Very laid back camaraderie in lecture and lab. Uses real life comparisons in lecture, and it helps keep you awake. Fun extra credit, though no one probably needs it. Would recommend!!

Awesome guy. Take the test once, discuss it, and take it again and average out the scores. If you can take him over the summer or maymester then DO IT! I barely did any work and he is very chill about grades. No way I deserved an A but I got it. Take this guy. Labs are easy too and drops the worst midterm. Barely uses the book
He is a very good teacher No doubt one of the best at The Ohio State. If you have a chance to take him take him

I just took Earth Science 151: natural hazards with Professor Barton, and I really enjoyed the class. Even though it can get pretty boring, he lets you take the exam once, then discuss the exam in groups, then take the exam again, then averages the scores. Go to class, because he gives out exam answers in class! He is a good professor.

While his accent is endearing, and he seems to have a good sense of humor, he is clearly not interested in teaching or helping his students succeed at all. His tests have almost nothing to do with the material he teaches, and are poorly worded. Everything highlighted in red on the powerpoints have no significance. This class was so frustrating.

Very charming, clear about the course material. He let us take exams twice and got to discuss answers in groups before the second time and averaged the two scores. The material is quite boring, but his humor makes up for it.

I just took ES151 (Natural Disasters) thinking it would be semi-interesting... I was wrong. It was very dry material and I often found myself falling asleep during lecture (which he gives out answers in) His tests were kind of tricky, I had a 3.9 going into this class and got a B+. SO if you're looking for an easy A, I wouldn't really suggest it.

I enjoyed Mr. Barton. He is very witty and very knowledgable about earth sciences, what used to be called geology. I had him for a summer class and that is when I recommend students to take it if they are completing a sequence or just want to take it for fun.

Dr. Barton is the most laid-back professor I've ever had.  He is extremely nice, and although not a thrilling lecturer, he has a sense of humor that keeps things interesting a lot of the time.  I enjoyed his class much more than I anticipated.  His tests are hard but his grading policies are lax, and while the labs aren't that fun they're easy A's.

I took his Natural Hazards 151 class, easy.  I went to every class to listen to lecture so I wouldn't have to read the book.  You don't need it. Plus they put it in the library. He was funny sometimes, which made lecture less boring. Tests were easy because you could take it, discuss it with the class, then take it again and you get the average.

His exams are extremely hard, but labs will salvage your grade. He's funny but picks out the most random things for the exams. Also, he has patterns to his exam answers sometimes (ABCDE for five straight)... Make sure you do all the labs, busy work, and you wont have to worry if you do bad on exams.

Dr. Barton is a great teacher.  His tests can be hard but as long as you attend lectures you are fine.  He gives lots of test answers during lectures when attendance is low.  Homework and papers he grades by pretty much saying if its done you get an A and labs are super easy.
horrible teaching style.  Tests are way too hard for the material covered.

Dr. Barton is one of the good ones. Passionate about teaching, friendly, and f-ing hilarious. No, the class isn't easy, but WE'RE IN COLLEGE for christ's sake. Getting a B only involves minor reading and attendence.

Barton is awesome!  I thought he taught the class very well and I really learned some interesting things.  I feel like I actually got a lot out of this class (even though it is about rocks, so can be boring at times).  It's not one of those classes where you just memorize things for the exam and then forget them 2 minutes later.  Def. Recommended!
Class wasn't all that interesting, but the labs were usually really easy.  The tests weren't easy, but lowest score was dropped.  Overall not a bad course, just not "easy."

Dr. Barton is a nice guy with good intentions.  Yes, lectures are boring and the exams can be difficult if you don't go to lecture.  GO TO LECTURE.  He sometimes gave out free answers for the exams if the attendance was low.  Labs are easy.
He's a REALLY nice guy. The tests are hard, but there's a huge curve at the end.
No Comments

YES THE CLASS IS BORING, BUT UNLESS YOU ARE GUN HO ABOUT ROCKS ECT , IT WOULD BE BORING NO MATTER WHO TAUGHT IT! HE HAS A CUTE ENGLISH ACCENT AND YOU GET TO DROP YOUR WORST TEST GRADE, WHCIH IS ALWAYS NICE. YOU WATCH A LOT OF INTRESTING MOVIES IN LAB AND THEY DONT GIVE YOU BUSY WORK.AS LONG AS YOU TAKE NOTES AND SKIM THE CHAPTERS YOU'LL BE FINE!!!!

He is the most boring professor I've ever had. At least I could count on some naptime during his class every day.  His midterms and finals were too hard considering everyone only takes this class for a GEC... he needs to realize we aren't trying to major in geology, just want a passing grade... lol
No Comments

It's not Barton's fault that geology is boring.  I ended up enjoying the class a lot, thanks to him.  His jokes, his accent, his rapport with students--it all makes class interesting.  And his grading was not hard, especially since he gave free answers for midterms and the final.

Lectures boring, and repetitive sometimes. When attendence slacked, gave answers to both midterms and on final gave first 10 out of 60 questions. Lab's were easy as hell and on top of all this gave extra credit paper that was rumored to be worth extra 10% added to your grade! i don't know exact %%

Who is the fool that wrote the last comment. My roommate and I are maybe two of the dumbest kids at OSU and we got a straight B. He has a thick accent which keeps class intresting. I fell asleep everyday and still passed. Labs are cake and learning is memorization. This class was cash.

Absolutely impossible;the worst and the nastiest professor I've had in four years at OSU;had ridiculously difficult midterms and finals, and only let you use half of the class time to take them;labs were hard,too-had to memorize rocks afterseeingthem once

The class itself isn't bad at all. Just weekly discussion posts and practice quizzes, and a 2 page paper to write every few weeks. Most of the things that are taught are either common sense or can be easily researched. A very simple GE to take if you need one.

The teacher was horrible. He was an extremely tough grader on the very few assignments we did have and assigned a major group project with no notice nor was it on the syllabus. He was rude to students, discussed other students grades when they will not in class to other students, and laughed at students answered or interrupted

Course content was interesting. He was not clear, professional, or respectful. Would call on individuals to suggest answers then interrupt students or laugh when they answered.  Assigned project that was not on syllabus. Asked for the students opinions on if he should notify absent people of an exam redo. Exams were extremely bias. no curve. MEAN!

This professor is absolutely HORRIBLE. Although I received an A- in the course, he is rude, talks about students while they aren't there about their grade, and is condemning. He reads off all of his lecture slides, gets his information directly from Wikipedia, and manages to ask outrageous questions on the exams. Exam averages were 60%, no curve.

Had this man for a study abroad program he hosts. He made racist comments about my ethnicity and started to laugh about it. Honestly, it is surprising how the school allows this to happen but this professor needs to be removed. AVOID at all costs!
You would think a professor teaching an online course would be required to have a basic understanding of the internet, but this is not the case.

I did not appreciate being graded on grammar and spelling when the slides and quizzes were filled with grammar and spelling mistakes. Due dates varied, were usually due on Tuesday which meant the material had to be rushed through. I regurgitated information more than I comprehended it. This class was a waste of time + energy

This is a very discussion-heavy class, meaning you'll be posting responses for weekly discussions, which is fine, but the way the due dates are set up in this class isn't conducive to learning the material. Your weekly post is due the Tuesday after the module opens which gives you little time to look over material. Also quizzes aren't graded.
Avoid at all costs and save yourself the trouble. He does not care for his students and completely irrelevant test questions. Save yourself the trouble.
Does not care about you succeeding, just a number on a spread sheet.
Worst class I have ever taken at Ohio State. I cannot believe someone in higher education teaches this way. I would avoid at all costs.

This class must be some elaborate joke. Each week you are given a set of slides to read that are obviously reused from pre-pandemic times when there was a lecture associated with them. Only now there are no lectures whatsoever, making the slides mostly incomprehensible. Grading makes no sense and you are never given any feedback. Avoid this class.

Terrible teacher who I do not think has a proper concept of teaching. Copies material from wikipedia which I am surprised is not plagiarism. Asks way too general fill in the blank questions and will not take another answer.

This class is such a joke and is some how hard in the worst way possible. He literally copies and pastes passages from Wikipedia on exams and wants us to fill in blanks with no notes or any materials. I am surprised he is able to teach given his class structure and overall teaching style. Worst professor I have ever had at OSU.

He gives a 91 question test and expects us to complete it in 80 minutes. He takes off for proper spelling yet half his questions are not even spelled correctly. You know its a bad course when the only things underlined and highlighted in the syllabus are NO EXTRA CREDIT, NO ACCEPTANCE OF LATE WORK, and NO ROUNDING WILL BE APPLIED. Such a joke

Dr. Ibaraki is such a nice guy and he really wants his students to do well. But his tests often don't make any sense! He tests on things he doesn't mention and neglects information he stresses during lectures. Lovely guy, ridiculous testing style. He does offer extra credit after everyone fails the tests (literally Organic Chem all over again)

Dr. Ibaraki is one of my favorite professors at Ohio State. I have had him for multiple courses and at first his accent and teaching style took some time to adjust to, but he really wants everyone to learn and succeed. A lot of his lectures consist of exercises done with groups and as long as you do the work and try, he will round you to an A.

AVOID AT ALL COST. Exams are SUPER specific. He doesn't provide rubrics or clear grading criteria. He makes this class hard for no reason and is rude. Hard to understand because he spits everywhere and has a thick accent. He uses the textbooks stock slides. I am an A student and am very challenged by this class. Also  no allow electronics n class.

Although it may be tough to clearly understand Dr. Ibaraki from the start of the semester, you begin to catch onto the flow of the class pretty quickly. The pop quizzes can be tough and specific, but it was never unreasonable and they greatly prepared you for his exams. He is very helpful when you meet with him and is happy to help anytime he can.

Dr. Ibaraki is not the greatest professor in terms of clarity. For assignments, especially group and individual projects, you really have no idea what he expects from you. Be prepared for alot of group work and very specific exams. The bright spot of this course is that it is curved so you'll get a higher final grade than expected!

Earth Science 3411 was easily the worst decision I have ever made picking classes at Ohio State.  He is not clear WHATSOEVER, and his exams were probably the hardest tests any professor at Ohio State could offer.  DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!  It is 100% a GPA destroyer.

He is actually helpful & it is obvious what is going to be on his quizzes and exams.  He doesn't lie about them...  This class is only math heavy if you think that one or two problems where you convert units is difficult when he even gives you the conversion factors.... Not the most interesting class but easy with the curve.
Does not use textbooks :(

He is difficult for me to understand, but a nice guy. A little weird for sure. Very knowledgeable, but speeds through things too quickly for non-geology/science majors. I would recommend taking another course if you aren't strong in math/science....
No Comments
Great guy, interested in teaching and helping students.  I would take any class with him.  Interesting discussions and open to ideas.

Dr. Ibaraki's class was very effective at generating independent thoughts about the future of natural resources.  The work in the class was split between group projects and independent projects.  Individual homework assignments were relatively easy but don't tell him that....

This class was a terrible experience. I thought it would be an easy A, considering I have a 4.0 in my final semester. I WAS WRONG! He claims his test are from his lecture notes, but this is not true. I literally memorized ALL of my notes for the final and achieved a C on the exam! Class average was 48%. I barely got an A (90.46%) and I worked hard.

class is fairly easy - he gives bonus/extra credit opportunities  on exams. labs are easy a's. i got a b+ in the class without putting much effort at all. lectures are boring and so long but going to class isn't really necessary to do well at all. overall he was a nice prof and this was a very easy gec.
nice guy.  lectures are too long though. he makes it easy to get a B.  If you want an A you might want to look elsewhere.
Dr. Wilson blows my mind. She's so cool. The class is hard but she makes it interesting. She is very passionate about geology and works hard to make sure you understand the material.

Drags out her words, not a good public speaker.  Mandatory lecture because of in-class quizzes.  Labs are unorganized.  Class is very boring! Easy A if you do all labs and come to lecture to do quizzes.  I suggest taking 110 after this to finish off the series with william ausich..He wass a great prof!!

I love this professor!  Her class is fine, overall, but sometimes we get confused during her activities.  The movies are great, and they turn out to be a really valuable learning experience.  Go figure!  I love her flowing calcite vein-like hair.
It was a while back, but I totally remember Brandon. He was really tough, but would spend time helping you if you asked. I liked him. Kinda hot.

he's a nice guy who loves the subject and would do anything to help you.  however, he is such a hard grader it makes it impossible to want to work in his class b/c he just kills you on your labs. i can't describe how bad of a grader he is. i think he just graduated, so anyone who is taking an ES class is safe from this ridiculously hard TA
He is the WORST TA you will ever have. His labs are impossible and takes off for the smallest things. DO NOT TAKE ES 203 with McKenzie b/c he will be your TA and you will be MISERABLE.

This lab TA was by far the worst TA ive ever had! This was an earth science GEC. In no way shape or form should this class be as hard as he made it. You get .5 off of every lab for grammer and mispellings. We are not in english get outta town. I checked the time on my phone in class and a had a piece of chalk thrown at me. If you value class, dont.

Brandon is by far the most enthusiastic TA I have ever had. He is tough, and definitely requires a lot, but really, really makes an effort to help students who put in an effort themselves. My only complaint is that he puts a lot of emphasis on things like grammar-which isn't a problem, except that it's an EARTH SCIENCE class.

Brandon is tough; however, he is the friendliest and by far the most enthusiastic TA I have ever had at OSU.  He wants everyone to succeed and definitely puts students first.  If you are willing to put the time in, he will help you.  Do not take this course for an easy A, but take it if you want an intro course you will actually learn from.
This lab TA takes class far too seriously. He takes off a ton of points for things such as not showing all mathematical calculations and including units. Avoid his lab section if possible.

Mike is incredibly good looking with an awesome British accent. He's so cute and he cares about you actually learning the material. Tests are surprisingly tricky but study for them and you'll be fine.
Prof Wilkins is awesome! He is knowledgable, kind and good looking. Best class all semester!

EASY class. As an Environmental Public Health major that is on a Pre-Med track it was a relief that this class fit the interdisciplinary requirement, because it was SOOO easy. I went to two lectures the entire semester and pulled off an A because all of the quizzesexams are on Carmen and come straight from the Powerpoints. CTRL + F is your bff.

Professor Wilkins is a fantastic professor at Ohio State! He is very passionate about the material. His lectures are certainly long and he simply reads off of the powerpoint while explaining it in his own way. Attendance is certainly not mandatory but it helps to go to lecture. Overall, this class was not bad.

Professor Krissek is a great guy.  I definitely reccomend taking this for a GE if you are willing to show up to class (because his tests are based almost entirely off of his lectures).  Exams aren't bad because you are allowed one page note sheet. Just come to class and you will be good.

Dr. Krissek is great. While the content of the lectures can be a bit boring due to the long class time, he really loves what he's talking about. I didn't buy the book, just borrowed it from the library right before the exams. No homework but the labs took time outside of class but Earth Science majors should already expect that. Best teacher in geo
Dr. Krissek is a great guy! I took this class at Stone Lab and he remembered my name TWO YEARS LATER! Very knowledgeable and fun to be with out in the field. Highly recommended.

Dr. Krissek is a nice guy.  He tells good stories and cheesy science jokes. Content is boring, so it's worth showing up. He claimed "show up and take good notes and you'll do fine." This was not the case for me (non-sci major)-D on the first midterm. Get a used text online ($20). This will help. I got As on the other tests, and extra credit helped

Dr. Krissek is very interested in teaching. He knows the material so well and is one of the best lecturers I've had. Makes the material interesting and genuinely cares about his students. Attendance isn't required but showing up is really important because you understand the material better. Also, the field trips are fun and you learn a lot.

He's really nice and tries to make class engaging. I took this as a GE and I wouldn't recommend it unless you're interested in science. He assumes people in the class have a background knowledge of stuff he talks about! Very frustrating. The tests are kinda hard (and I studied) and by the way, there's three tests and that's your grade.

Class attendance is key. He will drop by the lab once or twice. Tries to make boring material interesting, and he has some interesting stories he sometimes mentions while he was doing ANDRILL in Antartica.

krissek is a renown oceanographer and a pretty straight dude...he makes the material as interesting as it can be...theres some extra credit...labs are easy...but the tests are no joke. they dont seem that bad when u take them then you wonder why you got a 76. study hard before tests. study the book. could prob skip every class and just read hard
Dr. Krissek is an interesting and clear lecturer, and just an all-around cool guy.  Whether you're a geology major or just need a science GEC, you should definitely take a class from him.
The tests were challenging but Dr. Krissek really made an effort to make the material make sense.  Gave lots of extra credit and a large curve, overall nice guy.
cool

Dr. Krissek is the man. Interested in the subject, takes the time to get to know the students, and even takes you on field trips to Lake Erie. Also gives an opportunity for extra credit. Labs were easy but tests were pretty darn tricky!
He is a good guy that is really interested in teaching.  I enjoyed him a lot as my teacher..he made boring topics into interesting subjects.

Prof. Krissek is an excellent lecturer.  He is clearly very interested in the subject and in teaching.  He balances very reasonable expectations of students at this level with much enthusiasm to share with those who want to explore the subject more deeply.
Go to class, go to lab, and DEF do the x-tra credit.....i should have failed but i got a C for the final.......he is a cool dude
Dr. Krissek is great!!  He is helpful and loves the subject. However, go to all the lectures and take good notes because his test are usaully from the lectures and any handouts given in class.

He told us to not read the text book.. he was right, all of his questions came from class/lab
My all-time favorite professor, hands down

I love Kerri! She helps you when you need it and she is very personable and approachable. She is a source of positive energy in class and overall a cool person.

By far one of the worst people I have met in my life, let alone prof. He is arrogant and rude and in incessantly telling his students they are stupid. He was a good prof. Most of my friends got A's in his class.

WORST TEACHER EVER. He clearly knows a lot, but is incapable of teaching it. Arrogant and rude, not helpful at all. I'm going to echo what everyone else said here...AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

Dr. Rashid was the worst teacher I think i've ever had.  He taught this class like it was a masters class at MIT rather than a 100 level class at OSU.  He was arrogant, rude, and didn't help any student that needed it.  His tests and slides cover completely different material and he doesn't curve.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

I agree, he was very stubborn and when students asked questions he had that "You're wrong" air about him.
