AVOID

AVOID AT ALL COSTS! WORST professor I have EVER had (and I'm a senior).  Does not specify what is on the test, just says read, then when we all failed the test, he refused to curve it.  Very rude, not helpful, stubborn, has no problem failing the whole class, doesn't use carmen, not cooperative, even his TAs have issues with him. AVOID AVOID AVOID!

Posts all reading for course on Carmen. I did study abroad while taking his course and he was fantastic about working with me. Gives study guides for tests and as long as you actually do them and study, you will do fine on the exams. Attendance is important though because the material he presents is incredibly complex.

Attendance isn't mandatory but he gives pop quizzes and attendance checks worth 5 points (5% of your grade,too).  Exams aren't impossible. He gives a practice test that is almost identical to actual exams. He throws a few random/nitpicky ?s on the actual exams so that not everyone gets 100s. Didnt even buy the book but lab manual is a necessity.

She assigns a lot of group work doing it all on google docs and she doesn't really seem to know what is going on. It's frustrating and leaves you confused. We didn't find out when or what the final was comprised of until a month before classes were over.
Brandon was cool, definitely get him off topic because then he's hilarious. Very cynical
He's great, funny, and willing to help you out.
a savior in a class with multiple TA'a and Profs, literally the best TA I've had in a long time
He was my TA for this class and i loved him! He was so funny and he really tried to help when someone didn't understand something. He is really easily distracted though!
Honestly a terrible teacher. All over the place in lecture, his powerpoint slides don't even make sense. Not approachable or polite when you ask for help.
Cool guy- tries to make it interesting. But half the time I dont know what he's talking about.

His lectures are crazy confusing and unorganized. He often "makes up" answers to student questions. His lectures are entertaining, but he talks a lot and his powerpoints also have a lot to write down. The material is simple, but its delivery is confusing. Fun professor, cool guy, but material is all over the place. First year lecturer.

Odd professor. He does try to make the class funny and interesting- he swears a lot and makes college jokes. However, his lectures are extremely confusing and he does not make coherent sense when talking. His quizzes read like a kid wrote them. The class would be better if he put forth more effort. Fun lectures, but not worth the confusion.
He's an undergrad, so since he's also a TA he 1) knows what he's talking about, and 2) can relate to us as undergrads. He's helpful and cute to look at.
You have to go over the textbook urself! The tests are kind of difficult, but fortunately he gave of 10% of bonus problems. I got an A but the course is really time consuming.

By far the worst professor I have ever had at OSU. He is fine with students consistently failing the class. He does in class reviews and if a lot of people get the answer correct he says he will need to change the test and make it harder.  His excuse is that he wants to make the class worth our money. Save yourself the stress, don't take this class

He says that his average is a 62 and you should be happy with that grade. His questions have nothing to do with what we went over in class and he is not very clear on what he is trying to say. It is much harder than a 100 level class is ment to be. I found it was more helpful not to go to class and get confused, and to study the text book.

Not the most difficult class, but pretty boring lectures at times.  Foland was reasonable about assignments and tests, but studying is still needed.  He is pretty friendly and would probably be helpful outside of class.

People aren't kidding when they say this is the hardest class they've ever taken. Insane amounts of work and studying to do. Professor Foland is the nicest guy in the world, but is nearly incomprehensible in his lectures. There is a curve, but even that may not save you.

Foland is so boring, nearly impossible to follow lecture, and it hardly helps anyway.  Tests are very difficult for a 100 level class.  Not an easy A at all.  Averages on all tests were about 67 and he was happy with that.  Stay away from him if at all possible.

The tests are extremely detailed and over tons of information. We read almost the entire textbook during the class. Labs are easy and a grade buffer for the tests. He also has about 10 bonus questions on every test, and curves. Not the easiest GEC, but not awful either.

Seemed like a really nice guy but he acted like he was teaching a 600 level class when it was a 100 GEC. Tests are next to impossible and staying awake in lecture is a challenge. Stay away from him if possible.

Do not take a class with Professor Foland! He thinks he is teaching a 600 level class when he is teaching a 100 level class. He makes the tests so ungodly hard. Worst class I have taken in four years at OSU!

The Lecture are boring but not mandatory, he puts it all online.  Goes indepth about topics, but questions can really be thought through.  Nice man overall, likes students to interact.  Lab never takes the full time.

Hardest class I've ever taken!  This is definitely not an easy GEC.  I got an A in the course, but it was a TON of work.  Weekly labs, prelabs, homeworks, 3 field trips, 3 exams, 2 finals... just be prepared to be busy.

WARNING: DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! Foland is extremely boring and extremely hard.  Even going to lecture everyday and studying for tests I still struggled to just pass the class! Tests are next to impossible. Plain and simple, DO NOT TAKE!
I think He Ask Phd level questions for 100 level class hardest class ever had
Nicest man ever, really cares about his students. Know what he's talking about.    I enjoyed the class but it was very difficult and time consuming.  Not an easy GEC blow off class.

Class was difficult, but in the end I got a decent grade depsite the odds. Go to class and labs. Prof.Foland is VERY Passionate about his field and is very knowledgeable. Nicest teacher. Stay on top of work and ask questions. Show some interest and you should be fine
Nice guy, gives out candy like everyday is halloween BUT... there were three mandatory field trips (one of which was on a sunday?!) and the exams were pretty difficult

Foland is a very sweet man, but even all his candy can't make up for the fact that his class is painfully boring - he lectures straight fromt the book and rambles off on random tangents.  He seems very interested and passionate about geo, but he doesn't realize this is a GEC - we're not geo majors!

Hmm. Loves to help students but gives scattered lectures (use his notes!). Not sure if that's good thing? Regardless he has a heart of gold! Like GEO 628 said, don't you dare believe him when he says you don't need to memorize something. That's the best advice I can give-otherwise a good guy.
He's a very sweet man who cares a lot about his area of study and his students but the class was a ton of work and not so much fun.
A nice guy, but the class is really tough!  Three hour labs...I'm just sayin'...

Yes, the class was difficult... but it was the honors section. Dr. Foland worked very hard to provide a challenging learning environment that really delivered. He was understanding if a student had a valid problem and why I changed my major to Geology!
A very nice person, but a very boring and teacher with confusing tests.
I loved the trip to Hocking Hills. Also, rocks and stuff are cool. Dr. Foland likes to ride bikes. He da man!
Every test question is a trick question and eventually you just run out of time
His exams are impossible!! I think he expects you to be an expert on his topic of choice.  Don't believe him when he tells you you don't have to memorize anything.  DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!
No Comments

This class was interesting, yet very difficult for a GEC course. There were 9 quizzes, 3 midterms and 1 final. There was some math and chemistry involved in this course. Study EVERYTHING from all angles, as she will test you down to the smallest detail. She was very helpful and answered emails or questions with sincere kindness. Amazing teacher.

This is a 5 day a week class and you have to show up on a regular basis. I skipped about once a week and still managed an A. Dr. Sheets is very willing to help you as she is very interested in her subject matter, always inviting students to her office hours. Don't bother with the books or readings focus on the powerpoints she posts.
DO NOT SKIP CLASS! A little bit too difficult for a GEC. Be prepared to do a lot of memorizing- ALL of the little details. You can do well in here if you go and put in the time.
WAY too hard for a GEC.  Did worst in this 100 level class than my 500 level courses for my major.  I thought it would be interesting but it was way too hard, I wouldn't take this class

Dr. Sheets is very helpful and easy to understand. This class counted for my physical science, and I am very happy i chose to take it. She really loves what she does. If I had to take another geology class, I'd try to find one that she was teaching. Class attendance is important, but the textbook is not. Quizzes & exams are easy if you go to class.

I was interested in gems before this class. I learned a lot-but this was crazy hard for a GEC. You have to go to EVERY lecture & read the book THOROUGHLY to pass the exams. Even with prior knowledge I thought some of the material was tough. Nice lady, but her class isn't like going to a natural history museum. If you take this class, don't  skip.

Prof sheets is awesome. She is very helpful and very driven. She knows what she is talking about and she really cares. She will not dumb herself down just because she teaches an intro class. She is also hot

It's nice that there's no lab in the class, but she is pretty hard for a 100-level course.  She is always saying her quizzes are "easy"...but maybe that's just because SHE writes them.  Then she says she won't try to stump you on exams "to be fair," but she still puts tricky questions on them. Be prepared to do work for this GEC...
This professor taught to the lowest common denominator. The lessons were below the high school level.

Tries way too hard for an entry level course. No teacher should advise her students NOT to ask questions because SHE feels the test is easy.

Prof. Sheets is very nice, and obviously interested in what she does.  The class is definitely harder than i expected for 100 level.
he was my ta for this class and he made the class enjoyable. he is great at explaining everything. i would highly recommend him

If you could describe Mr. Stutz with one would it would be passionate.As this was his first quarter teaching(GTA) he took on a major challenge in structural geology and made us all more proficient by allowing us to think for ourselves. Favorite Quote:"I am not going to hold your hand through this..." Overall the best TA at OSU...get some
I would definitely recommend Dr. Hansen as he is just a great Professor.  His lectures are informative and his mid-terms are fair.
Despite the fact that the class is sort of boring, I really liked Dr. Hansen.  He's one of the nicest teachers I've had.  The tests were pretty easy and straightforward, and the labs even easier.
Holy crap this class was boring.  I went to every class and slept for two hours straight.  Study the powerpoints he puts on Carmen.  I got an A- and a cure for my insomnia.

This was one of the easiest classes I've ever taken.  The tests were multiple choice and were so easy the final only took me half an hour to do!  He knows a ton of stuff and is very informative.  Great class!

if you enjoyed this class at all, then you must be on crack. he does not find it necessary to put the ten pages of notes that he gives you in any type of order, and proceeds to ramble on about earthquakes.
Gives way too many notes!  Not very helpful and always unavailable.  Does not give any kind of outline for cumulative test that covers tons of notes.

Does a good job explaining everything. Gives a TON of notes. Tests are easy, labs are easy. Geol 100 is pretty interesting and he does a good job. Good guy if you get a chance to talk to him. It's a fun class.
No Comments

Overall, pretty good.  Had lecture slides for you to follow.  The tests were pretty hard but most of the information came from the notes in class.  Every test he would put extra questions on there that weren't covered.   The thing I hated was that I got a 93% and didn't get an A, 95% was an A... SUCKED so bad and this is suppose to be a 100 level
